column12: FLEXIBLE OPTICAL DISC AND METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR STABILIZING DURING WRITING AND/OR READING OF INFORMATION THEREON.
FLEXIBLE OPTICAL DISC AND METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR STABILIZING DURING WRITING AND/OR READING OF INFORMATION THEREON.
column13: Procede ameliore de stabilisation d'un disque optique flexible pendant que des informations sont ecrites et/ou lues sur celui-ci, et consistant a: (1) positionner de maniere predeterminee un disque optique plat, flexible, d'une epaisseur uniforme, par rapport a un axe de rotation; (2) mettre en rotation le disque sur cet axe a grande vitesse et avec une relation d'espace predetermine par rapport a une surface de reference lisse ayant une forme predeterminee et (3) coupler une region centrale entre le disque et la surface de reference a une source de gaz ambiant. A cet effet, un appareil et des configurations de disques, ainsi que des modes de realisation ayant des couvertures de disque flexibles, sont egalement decrits.
An improved flexible optical disc has a co-rotatable disc cover.

column12: Optical disc unit and method and apparatus for writing and/or reading information thereon
column13: An improved method of optically writing and/or reading high density information involves: (1) predeterminedly positioning a flat, uniformly thick, flexible, optical disc with respect to an axis of rotation; (2) rotating the disc on such axis at a high speed and in a predeterminedly spaced relation to a predeterminedly shaped, smooth, featureless reference surface and (3) coupling a central region between the disc and reference surface to an ambient gas source. Related apparatus and disc configurations, including embodiments having flexible disc covers, also are disclosed.

column12: Optical disc method, media and apparatus for writing and/or reading information
column13: An improved method of optically writing and/or reading high density involves: (1) predeterminedly positioning a flat, uniformly thick, flexible, optical disc with respect to an axis of rotation; (2) rotating the disc on such axis at a high speed and in a predeterminedly spaced relation to a predeterminedly shaped, smooth, featureless reference surface and (3) coupling a central region between the disc and reference surface to an ambient gas source. Related apparatus and disc configurations, including embodiments having flexible disc covers, also are disclosed.
column16: EASTMAN KODAK COMPANY A CORP. OF N.J (1980-06-17)
column32: Ahmed et al., The Aerodynamic Stabilization of Video Discs , IEEE Transactions on Consumer Electronics, vol. CL 21, No. 2, 5/75, pp. 131 138.;;Boyles, Self Pressurized Enclosure for Flexible Magnetic Disks, IBM Tech. Disc. Bulletin, vol. 19, No. 8, 1/77, pp. 3177 3178.

column12: Composable natural language lenses for collaborative streams
column13: Identification of content classes deemed important by users is received. Classifiers are trained on user communication text to recognize content matching content classes. A composite classifier is applied to text of communication among users of a second set of users, including tagging, by the composite classifier, content in text of communication among the users of the second set. The tagging is responsive to the classifiers recognizing their respective content classes in text of communication among the users of the second set.

column12: Air bag inflator and method of assembly
column13: An inflator (14) for inflating an inflatable vehicle occupant restraint (12) includes a body (60) of ignitable gas generating material, an igniter (260) for igniting the body (60) of gas generating material, and a housing (50) having a tubular wall (52) surrounding the body (60) of gas generating material. The tubular wall (52) has a longitudinal central axis (40), a plurality of outlet openings (100) through which gas flows radially outward, and an open end portion (232) with the contour of a dome centered on the axis (40). The inflator (14) further includes a circular end cap (56) which is located coaxially within the tubular wall (52). The end cap (56) supports the igniter (260) on the axis (40), and has a peripheral surface portion (216) with the contour of a dome centered on the axis (40). The open end portion (232) of the tubular wall (52) closely overlies the peripheral surface portion (216) of the end cap (56).
column15: MEDUVSKY ALEX G;;GOETZ GEORGE W;;GLAC EDWARD Q;;MAURER STEVEN W;;GEYER DAVID L;;FIORE DENNIS J;;WESTLAKE HEIDI M;;GEST WILLIAM E

column12: AIR BAG INFLATOR AND METHOD OF ASSEMBLY
column13: 본 발명은 팽창 가능한 자동차 탑승자 억제물(12)을 팽창시키는 팽창기에 관한 것이다. 팽창기는 가연성 가스 발생제 본체(60)와, 그 가스 발생재 본체를 점화하는 점화기(260)와, 가스 발생재 본체(60)를 둘러싸는 관형벽부(52)를 구비한 하우징(50)을 포함한다. 관형 벽부(52)는 종방향 중심 축선(40)과, 가스가 관통하여 반경방향 외측으로 유동하는 다수의 유출구(100), 및 축선(40)과 중심이 일치되는 돔형 외형을 갖는 개방 단부(232)를 구비한다. 팽창기(14)는 또한 관형 벽부(52)내에서 동축으로 배치되는 원형 단부캡(56)을 포함한다. 단부캡(56)은 축선(40)상에 점화기(260)를 지지하며, 축선(40)과 중심이 일치되는 돔형 외형을 가진 외주면(216)을 구비한다. 관형 벽부(52)의 개방 단부(232)는 단부캡(56)의 외주면에 밀접하게 겹쳐진다.
column15: MEDUVSKY ALEX G;;GOETZ GEORGE W;;GLAC EDWARD Q;;MAURER STEVEN W;;GEYER DAVID L;;FIORE DENNIS J;;WESTLAKE HEIDI M;;GEST WILLIAM E

column12: Air bag inflator and method of assembly
column13: An inflator (14) for inflating an inflatable vehicle occupant restraint (12) includes a body (60) of ignitable gas generating material, an igniter (260) for igniting the body (60) of gas generating material, and a housing (50) having a tubular wall (52) surrounding the body (60) of gas generating material. The tubular wall (52) has a longitudinal central axis (40), a plurality of outlet openings (100) through which gas flows radially outward, and an open end portion (232) with the contour of a dome centered on the axis (40). The inflator (14) further includes a circular end cap (56) which is located coaxially within the tubular wall (52). The end cap (56) supports the igniter (260) on the axis (40), and has a peripheral surface portion (216) with the contour of a dome centered on the axis (40). The open end portion (232) of the tubular wall (52) closely overlies the peripheral surface portion (216) of the end cap (56).

column13: A method, computer system, and computer program product for cognitively summarizing one or more collaborative moments is provided. An embodiment may include receiving a plurality of communications sent during a collaborative session. The embodiment may also include grouping the plurality of received communications into one or more bursts. The embodiment may further include assigning one or more keywords or one or more entities to each burst. The embodiment may also include generating a summary for each burst using one or more natural language processing techniques based on the assigned one or more keywords or one or more entities. The embodiment may further include transmitting the generated summary to each user participating in the collaborative session.
